alert.note: Alert for Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued August 03 at 7:18AM CDT until August 03 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM CDT FOR FRANKLIN...WESTERN WEBSTER...SOUTHEASTERN PHELPS...SOUTHWESTERN ADAMS...KEARNEY AND EASTERN HARLAN COUNTIES... At 718 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Axtell to Hildreth to Bloomington, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Franklin around 725 AM CDT. Upland around 730 AM CDT. Minden around 735 AM CDT. Campbell and Riverton around 745 AM CDT. Heartwell and Norman around 750 AM CDT. Bladen and Inavale around 755 AM CDT. Holstein around 800 AM CDT. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Hastings. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
